title: Field Hockey Field Goal Shooting Training: Game-Centered Learning and Representative Learning Design-Based Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of field hockey fundamentals and individual skills (dribbling, passing, basic shooting)
context.additional_context: Learners are university physical education students or field hockey players with competitive experience. Providing situational shooting training via mobile apps and video feedback in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Perform field goal shooting with at least 70% accuracy in a 5vs5 small-sided game environment reflecting real match situations.
Analyze and explain at least three cognitive-action linkage processes of players through GCL design missions.
Present a case of reinforcement learning in the wild (RLD) application through weekly project submissions (training video analysis reports) using a mobile app.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
